meanings.definition: A mark stamped on a letter or package showing the date and place of mailing.
meanings.sent1: The postmarked on the envelope indicated it was sent from New York.
meanings.sent2: I always look for the postmarked on letters to see where they came from.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a mysterious postmarked on the ransom letter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright postmarked on a dull day, bringing joy to all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The postmarked on the package was so clear, it felt like a little piece of the sender was with me.

meanings.sent1: Please postmarked the letters before dropping them off at the post office.
meanings.sent2: The clerk carefully postmarked each envelope to ensure proper delivery.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally postmarked his own hand while stamping the letters.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day are postmarked in my mind, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: Her kindness postmarked her as a person worth knowing, leaving a lasting impression on everyone she met.

meanings.sent1: The postmarked package arrived just in time for the party.
meanings.sent2: She received a postmarked letter from her pen pal in another country.
meanings.sent3: The postmarked envelope contained a surprise gift from a secret admirer.
meanings.sent4: His face lit up when he saw the postmarked package waiting for him.
meanings.sent5: The postmarked postcard brought back memories of a wonderful vacation by the sea.
